column1: back of a length outside off, left alone. Looking  for some movement, but there was hardly anything there from that length
good length outside off, straight through to the keeper
back of a length outside off, this one moves away slightly, very late as he pokes at it with no feet and is beaten
back of a length, angled in at off stump, back foot defence
back of a length outside off, poked off the back foot to covers
full outside off, this time it moves slightly and squares him up. Mushfiqur overruns at covers and misfields, and there's a mix-up, but no harm done in the end
133 kph, short and well wide, left alone
good length at the pads, holds his shape and glances it to fine leg
137 kph, back of a length in the corridor, nips back off the seam as he lets it go close to his body
back of a length, pitches on leg and deviates down the leg side where Liton has put in his first dive of the series
full and angled across the corridor, his stride is non-existent as he tries to drive through the line. Beaten on the outside edge
good length at off stump, gets a stride in this time and defends to covers
138 kph, back of a length outside off, climbs marginally as he lets it go
132 kph, full at off stump, small stride, full face of the bat and a well-timed push between wide-on and the non-striker
134 kph, good length outside off stump, Tharanga feels for it away from the body and is beaten
good length, angles in slightly outside off and straightens past Tharanga's attempted cover drive on the up
good length outside off, late movement away, he lets it go and it climbs sharply and thuds into the keeper's gloves
136 kph, full at off stump, angled inwards and he tries to flick it across the line. Thick inside edge onto the pad and the appeal is solitary from the bowler
137 kph, overpitched outside off, no movement, small stride forward and punched through the covers
short and wide, Liton takes this outstretched to his left in front of the slips
137 kph, back of a length at leg stump, deviates away sharply and squares him up. Thick outside edge through the slip cordon
good length at off stump, seam away and he lets it go
back of a length at the pads, flies past his thigh guard as he tries to glance it
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot to square leg who fumbles slightly, but they don't run through after a mix-up this time
140 kph, good length at off stump, pushed to covers off the front foot and they steal a quick single
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length, angled in at off stump, raps him on the thigh guard
129 kph, back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
135 kph, good length, wide outside off, leaves it alone
good length at middle stump, angled into the pads, nudged to square leg off the back foot
back of a length, well outside off, wouldn't reach it even if he tried, left alone
full at leg stump, swings down the leg side
134 kph, good length at the leg stump, nips back in slightly and hits him hard on the pads, but that's sliding down
132 kph, some bounce from back of a length, it's angled outside off and he pokes away from his body to gully

got him! Subashis doesn't seem to believe this, he's turning around jubilantly. Tharanga is surprised by the extra pace as this skids inside from an off stump line, beats his half-hearted defence and slams into the stumps

he's on a hat-trick! Back of a length outside off, swipes at it away from the body, gets an inside edge and Liton has taken it low to his right...oh hang on. He's overstepped. This will be overturned.
back of a length in the corridor, slight movement away and he lets it go this time
full outside off, nice stride in and driven straight to covers
130 kph, full and angled into the pads, he falls over slightly after putting a stride across but is in control of his flick. Fine leg runs a long way to his right
short and wide, left alone
back of a length, just outside off, lets it go as it climbs steeply
134 kph, edged and safe! Full outside off, he's gone for a big cover drive, gets a thick outside edge that flies past third slip
full and angled in at off stump, bat turns as he punches it to mid-on
full outside off, not to the pitch as he drives away from his body. Inside half of the bat and it rolls to cover's left
back of a length outside, watches it closely as he lets it go
back of a length outside off, moves away after pitching, lets it go
good length outside off, slight away movement in the air and off the pitch, left alone
good length, angled in outside off and moves away after pitching. He wanted to push at that but let it go at the last moment
good length outside off, nips back off the seam, too wide to cause damage, left alone
bouncer at off stump, too short, enough time for Mendis to duck under it
good length outside off, defended to covers
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, inside half of the bat on his back foot defence
back of a length outside off, nips back after pitching, but he's covered the off stump and lets it go comfortably
short and wide outside off, leaves it alone
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
full at off stump, pushes forward and mistimes his on-drive. Still getting used to his awkward pace
full outside off, slight movement away, gets in shape nicely but drives off the bottom of the bat, straight to covers
good length outside off, left alone, carries through nicely to the keeper
full outside off, leans in with a stride and pushes it past covers to get off the mark
good length at middle stump, falls away into the off side as he pushes it to square leg
back of a length at off stump, hurried on the back foot defence
good length in the corridor, carries on with the angle as he lets it go
136 kph, full and angled across off stump, pushed into the off side off the front foot
139 kph, back of a length, pushed across the off stump. Wants to pull this in front of square but checks his shot and gets an inside edge onto the thigh guard
139 kph, back of a length in the corridor, rides the bounce and opens the face as he pushes it to gully
139 kph, back of a length at middle stump, goes back and cuts the angle across as he defends it into the leg side
bouncer at off stump, hurries him as he ducks and sways with his eyes on the ball
full at middle stump, shapes to whip this through midwicket but offers the full face and pushes it to mid-on
132 kph, good length outside off, lets it go
full at off stump, bat turns slightly as he tries to drive it past the bowler, loses power as a consequence and it doesn't get past
short ball outside off, he ducked quickly, but that one sat in the pitch and floated through
back of a length at the thigh, glanced fine
back of a length at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
back of a length on the pads, catches him on the thigh guard as he tries to turn it to fine leg, slight hesitation with the running but square leg was quite deep
140 kph, back of a length at off stump, goes on the back foot and drops it into the off side with soft hands
good length, angled across off stump, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes and defends back to the bowler
good length at off stump, nips off the seam and angles away, he lets it go

back of a length, angled across the left-hander. He jumps and pushes away from his body, drops it in front of slip and Mendis is positive that he wants a run. Beats the fielder easily and makes his ground
full at middle stump, waits and pushes it late past square leg's left
wide of the crease, good length, angled across outside off stump, goes forward and defends
full at leg stump, driven straight to wide mid-on
bouncer, too short, comfortably ducked
back of a length at off stump, pushes well away from the body into the off side
good length, tails in at off stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length down the leg side, catches the thigh guard and flies past the diving keeper
back of a length, angled into the batsman, pushed to square leg off the back foot
140 kph, back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, keeps slightly low as he gets behind it and defends into the off side. Sends his partner back
bouncer at middle stump, well above him, ducks under it
good length, angled in at middle stump, defended with a full face into the leg side
good length, starts at middle, angles down as it raps him on the pads. Loud appeal, but not an optimistic one
good length, angled in at off stump, defended off the front foot, inside half of the bat
back of a length, angled in at the pads, pushed to square leg off the back foot
good length outside off, tails in as he puts in a stride and pushes it to covers
wide of the crease, good length, aimed at off stump, defended with an angled bat
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, cuts back in sharply and raps him on the thigh guard off the inside edge, loud appeal is turned down
back of a length outside off, flies through at chest height as he tries to leave on the front foot
good length at off stump, driven back to the bowler on the up
back of a length, climbing in the corridor, but he ramps this over the slip cordon with full control
good length, angled in from wide outside off, left alone
shot. Full at off stump, healthy stride and a middled off-drive, straight to mid-off
good length, angled in at off stump, defended with soft hands to steal the single
124 kph, off cutter, back of a length at leg stump, squares him up and hits the shoulder of the bat as he tries to push it into the leg side
short and wide outside off stump, goes back and caresses it in front of point
wide of the crease, good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the pads
124 kph, off cutter, good length at middle stump, through the defence early and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side
129 kph, good length outside off, angles away further wide, left alone
good length outside off, slides back in with the arm, goes back and chops it late past backward point
good length at middle stump, whipped into the leg side but catches short leg and rolls to midwicket
short at off stump, cuts with soft hands for lack of room, straight to backward point
back of a length at middle, goes low, hangs back and slaps it to square leg
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle, gets low again, tries to turn it past square leg and finds him once more
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and tailing in at off stump, pushed with soft hands to short midwicket
short and wide, back and across and cuts it nicely, Mahmudullah dives at gully and gets one hand on it, parries it into the covers region
off cutter, good length outside off, dropped into the covers, quick single. Fielder hits the stumps direct with an underarm flick, but Mendis was in
full at off stump, pushed to short extra off the front foot, nicely behind the line
124 kph, full at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket
good length at off stump, pushed to point with an open face
back of a length at middle, goes back and nudges it through the open square leg area
good length outside off, slight turn as he shoulders arms
good length at off stump, comes in with the arm, forward defence
tossed up at off stump, gets the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler as he tries to drive inside-out
good length at off stump, turns slightly and bounces to catch it high on the bat. Mendis wants to steal another single, sent back and makes it safely as we see another direct hit
where did that come from? back of a length in the corridor, and jags away viciously as he throws his bat away from the body and beats the outside edge
good length in the corridor, lets it through without offering a short
full outside off, pushed through the covers off the bottom of the bat
good length at off stump, dropped into the off side off the back foot
good length at off stump, slight shape in, defended to mid-off
bouncer at the chest, watches it closely and turns it down to fine leg
good length at middle stump, goes back and whips it straight to short leg
good length at middle stump, can't beat short leg with the flick once more

gone! Good length outside off, once more there's no turn and this slides to catch the under-edge as he tries to chop it past point. Only chops it onto the stumps. He was half-forward, half-back with that, and had no room to be attempting that shot
full at off stump, driven sweetly to mid-on
good length at middle stump, closes the face early and gets a leading edge into the off side
full and flat at middle stump, flicked past square leg
full at off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
good length outside off, solidly behind it as he defends on the front foot
128 kph, back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
128 kph, back of a length in the corridor, solidly behind it as he defends off the back foot
good length at off stump, slight movement away, but he gets another defensive shot off the middle
good length outside off, swings away and gets a thick outside edge on the defensive push
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, forward defence
flighted full at middle stump, flicked to square leg
dropped short at middle stump, pulls it out to deep midwcket who runs to his left and releases quickly
good length at off stump, no turn, pushed to covers on the up
tossed up at off stump, forward defence, inside edge lands on the ground and goes to short leg
back of a length in the corridor, keeps slightly low as he defends off the back foot
132 kph, back of a length at off stump, moves away slightly, defended with an open face to backward point
back of a length outside off, pushed off the back foot to point's right and he fumbles it as they complete a tight run
good length outside off stump, defended to mid-off
good length at middle stump, pushed to square leg off the pads
good length outside off, nips back in and raps him on the pads in front of off stump, but it looks like an inside edge and the appeal is turned down...they don't review
full at off stump, defended to covers
good length at leg stump, goes back and turns it to short fine using his wrists
good length on the pads, pushed in front of square leg
full at off stump, driven to point
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
full at leg stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length in the corridor, back foot defence
short outside off stump, cuts away and keeps low as it beats his cut shot with no feet
good length at middle stump, jumps up and moves slightly away, gets the sticker and rolls to gully
good length in the corridor, nips away, left alone
good length in the corridor, defended cautiously
good length in the corridor, this one is angling in slightly but Mendis is happy to leave
good length at off stump, slight turn away, defended to point with an open face
good length outside off, hasn't picked the arm ball, leaves it alone
back of a length at middle, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, forward defence
fired flat and full at the pads, holds his shape and drives this to mid-on's right
tossed up at off stump, driven beautifully but extra cover is in place and it goes straight to him
good length in the corridor, that slight straightening again and it gets the thick outside edge and into the slip region as he defends
good length, angled in at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven past the bowler with a straight bat, he's focusing hard and gets a reward
goes for the bouncer, gets it well short and well wide
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot with the angle
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length outside off stump, turns and climbs as he lets it go
back of a length at off stump, driven to that man at extra cover again, off the back foot
good length outside off, arm ball, pushed to point
80 kph, full at off stump, driven to short cover
good length outside off, left alone as it turns away
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, angled in, nicely behind the line to defend off the back foot
good length at off stump, slight shape away as he tries to turn it into the leg side with the angle. Safe in the end, offers the full face and pushes to mid-on
137 kph, short outside off, jags back and hits the top of the handle in front of his chest as he shapes to cut it
pushes it to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, punched to cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, steps out and gets an inside edge onto pad after stepping out
good length at off stump, steps out, gets to the pitch and drives to mid-off
arm ball, good length at middle stump, goes down with the angle and hits the pads
tossed full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended to cover
short and angled in at off stump, goes deep in the crease and slaps it regally in front of square
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, thick inside edge down to fine leg as he pokes at it
bouncer at off stump, takes his eyes off as he ducks. This swerves away wildly after passing the batsman and Liton is wrong-footed and has to dive to catch that
good length, angled in at off stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
good length outside off, jags away, left alone
bouncer, angled in at the throat, gets well below this and takes his eyes off. Liton has to dive to his left this time
good length at off stump, covers the line nicely and defends off the front foot
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
short and wide, sits up nicely and he slaps it through the covers
good length at off stump, defended to short cover
good length at off stump, tries to push this past short cover off the front foot, not enough power
dropped short at middle stump, slams it in front of deep square who runs to his left and puts in a slide at the boundary
good length at middle stump, forward defence
back of a length, angled across the corridor, defended with an open face to point
back of a length at middle, turned with the wrists to square leg
oh this is classy. Back of a length at off stump from around the wicket. It's a slower ball that sits up for him. He shapes up for a pull, adjusts for the pace and and taps it past square leg
good length outside off stump, spins away after pitching
full at off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot, straight to short cover
good length at off stump, defended onto silly point's boot
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
full down the leg side, pitches and slides past the keeper's shoe as he misses the attempted sweep...in fact he's got a feather on that and it's runs
full at off stump, punched to cover
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, glanced to short fine
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
off cutter, good length at off stump, opens him up but he gets out the full face and defends as it spins away
full and wide outside off stump, opens his arms and tries to slam this hard, no timing and it bounces to extra cover

the dots balls have got to him. Tried to hit the leather off the previous ball to find a fielder, this time he tries the same outside off. But the ball was shorter than that, and it was an off cutter at 127kph that spat out sharply from a length and got a thick edge to gully at his attempted drive on the up
full toss outside off, swings away a long way, but he just has to get bat on this and does. Slices it between slip and gully
good length outside off, gets slow and sweeps it on the head, all along the ground to long leg
tossed up at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, shuffles across and defends to short leg with the turn
good length outside off, this time he's played inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge as it holds its line
short and outside off, loses his shape as he cuts with no timing
good length at off stump, forward defence
just falls short of gully! Back of a length at middle stump, closes the face too early on the leg glance, the ball straightens and gets a leading edge that doesn't carry
good length outside off, gets a stride and plays an expansive drive to deep point
full at off stump, driven back past the bowler to mid-off
good length, tailing away from outside off, leaves it alone
good length outside off, covers the line and lets it go
slower ball, starts at leg stump, doesn't turn quickly enough and he hits against the angle into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, turns away and he tickles it fine off the back foot to bring up his fifty
tossed up at leg stump, leans in and punches it to long-on
short and turning in at middle stump, goes well back, makes room and chops it past backward point
flat at a good length, off stump line, gets low and sweeps it fine
back of a length outside off, straightens, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, turned into the leg side off the back foot
oooh. Good length, bowled into the corridor from around the wicket, pitches and straightens to just miss the outside edge
good length, angles down the leg side this time and he flicks it to fine leg's left
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to mid-off
119 kph, full slower ball outside off, he's through the drive early and it trickles to mid-off
wide of the crease, at a length, angled across from outside off, punched to extra cover

dropped short at middle stump, goes back, notices the quickish pace and gets low to swipe horizontally and keep it on the ground as he pulls to fine leg
good length at off stump, forward defence
short at off stump, jumps back in his crease and chops it late, wide of first slip
full at off stump, pushed to short midwicket
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot

just gets it over cover. Full slower ball outside off from around the wicket, he loses the discipline and shape he has shown so far and throws his hands at this. Nowhere near the pitch and he hits it uppishly over cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot

full at off stump, driven to mid-off's left

drifted full down the leg side, tucked to long leg's right with soft hands
good length at the pads, pushed to short fine leg off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, goes back, turns it to short fine again
back of a length, finds short leg with the glance once more
full at off stump, defended to cover
good length, angled in at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside edge
back of a length in the corridor, back foot defence
good length at off stump, nicely behind it as he defends off the front foot
attempted bouncer outside off, sits up slowly, pulled to deep square without any trouble
bouncer angled down the leg side, gets good bat on this pull and hit's it to fine leg's left. He covers a couple of yards to his left and puts in a tumbling dive
back of a length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-on
bouncer outside off, goes for the hook this time, he's in no position - feet in the air, bat still halfway through the swing - and he's beaten
this time he gets behind it and hooks into the floor from middle stump to pick up a single
good length at off stump, driven to extra cover off the front goot
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch, straight to extra cover
good length at off stump, forward defence
full at leg stump, driven to short midwicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
tossed up at middle stump, goes for the sweep and gets himself in a bit of trouble, but in the end manages to squeeze it out to the deep
back of a length outside off, back foot drive to deep point
full at off stump, driven to mid-on off the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, keeps the hook down, gets it well to the left of fine leg and runs back hard
shot! Short at off stump, not enough pace to be persisting with this tactic. He has plenty of time to get his hands in front and short-arm jab this pull to the deep midwicket boundary
full at the pads, holds his shape, gets the head on top of the pitch, and clips it wide of mid-on
good length outside off and he defends it solidly off the front foot

back of a length at middle stump, shoveled off the back foot to mid-on's right
full, well outside off, left alone
good length, wide, left alone

good length outside off, pokes at it, beaten on the outside edge
good length at off stump, straightens slightly and gets the outside half of the bat as he fends at this, single down to deep point
good length at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
yorker at off stump, tries to jam this to the third man boundary, finds gully yet again
bouncer at off stump, doesn't go for the ramp, sways away
good length outside off, comes in with the arm, lets it go
short and wide, cut to deep cover
full at middle stump, flicked to square leg
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
full at leg stump, misses the flick and catches it on his pads
back of a length at the pads, glanced to fine leg
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to deep cover
short and wide, chopped to deep cover
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, back foot defence
good length at off stump, defended to point
full at leg stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, driven to silly mid-off
full at middle stump, forward defence
full outside off, drives it past extra cover, finds sweeper
full at middle stump, goes for the paddle and just gets bat on it. That was too full for that shot. Rolls down to short fine
full at middle stump, forward defence
pitched up on middle stump, clipped off the pads to midwicket

belated appeal from Shakib for caught behind. Sees the keeper go up and then makes an appeal. Marais Erasmus is unmoved, but Mushfiqur Rahim has opted for a review. It is sliding in with the arm and pitches on leg stump channel. Mendis gets down to sweep but the ball straightens after pitching and it is anyway not full enough to sweep. The question is if he has got a glove to it as he misses with the sweep and the ball goes to the wicketkeeper. Not an easy call for the third umpire. Seems like the ball has snuck from beneath the under edge but it really is touch and go. TV umpire asks for a clean audio in slow-mo and there does not seem to be any noise as the ball goes to the keeper. No conclusive evidence to say the ball has touched the bat, says S Ravi, so the on-field call remains
flighted outside off and driven into the covers off the front foot
flatter fullish ball, comes forward and blocks into the off side
bit uppish as he tucks this into the leg side, held up a little bit but the ball lands short of the fielder at midwicket. Well short
nudged through square leg for a single to end the over
poor delivery from Mustafizur. Short and wide with no protection behind square on the off side. The batsman hangs back and just opens the face of his bat to steer it to third man
fuller ball outside off, opens the bat face and steers it to gully
stops a bit on Tharanga, slower delivery, on a length and cutting back in to Tharanga, who takes the bottom hand off as he bunts it into the turf
short of a length and coming into Tharanga, who slightly backs away before dropping it into the off side for a quick single
defended into the off side off the front foot

edged and not carrying to the keeper. Good length bal, angling across as he rolls his fingers across the seam. Mendis sticks his bat out and the ball goes off the outside edge. Wicketkeeper moves to his right and does a good job of collecting it as the ball was dipping on him and he had to gather it on the bounce
pitched up on leg stump, clipped away to the on side
pitched up on middle and leg, defended down the pitch off the front foot
punched down to long-on
good length ball, tucked away off the hips to the leg side
tossed up outside off, pushes it down to long-on for a comfortable single
fuller ball, angling in on off and middle, drilled off the front foot back towards the bowler

full and outside off, wants to tempt the batsman by coming forward and drive. Tharanga does so but with the ball holding its line, he is able to drive it easily square of the wicket. That's the fifty for Tharanga
full and a tad closer to the batsman this time around, Tharanga is solid in defence as he knocks the ball off the front foot back to the bowler

first signs of urgency from the batsman.The clouds are beginning to close in quite quickly. Looking to hit it on the up straight down the ground but there is no real pace on the delivery and he gets the timing all wrong as well. It lands just in front of mid-off who is running back
offers up width outside off with a fullish ball and it is easy pickings for Tharanga who leans forward and crunches an uppish drive through the covers region
width on offer again, poor bowling from Mustafizur. Tharanga crashes it square of the wicket and the ball goes to the square third man boundary rapidly
short of a length ball, not spinning away a big distance but enough room for Mendis who backs away and cuts the ball away
coming on straight at a fullish length on and around off, defended from the crease to the bowler

length ball, tucked off the pads behind square and Mendis takes off for a single. Tharanga hesitates but with Mendis charging along anyway, responds late. Square leg fires a throw at the keeper's end but Mendis makes it
dabs it away into the on side
driven off the front foot to covers
loopy and sliding in, punched away to covers
shuffles across the stumps and tries to put away this length ball but under-edges it to the turf. Not sitting up as much as he would have liked
full and angling in, tries to glance it fine but cannot make contact as the wicketkeeper moves across and collects it
fullish and coming into the batsman from outside off, kept out to the off side to the covers region. Bat face turns in his hand as he makes contact with the ball

full and wide outside off, goes hard at it and fails to keep the ball along the ground. But he has got it square enough, beats gully and point as he splits the gap and the ball races into the boundary
good length and nipping in, uses the angle to tuck it into the on side
short of a length and cutting back in sharply. Does not account for the movement and plays the line. Sticks his bat outside off and the ball goes off the inside edge to the fine leg region
comes forward and lazily pushes this fuller ball but it drifts away from him and goes off the outside edge to the gully region
a lot closer to him this time, full again and the batsman presses forward before easing it down to long-on. Sri Lanka lead is 300 now
comes down the track and drills it straight to midwicket

gets nice and low early. It's flighted and loops in on off and middle. Enough room for the batsman as he gets the front leg out of the way, goes down on one knee and slogs it powerfully over deep midwicket
length ball, tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side
flighted outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length ball, angles in around off and it is punched away to midwicket
short of a length and outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers
punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short and angling away outside off, lays into a pull shot after he fetches it from outside off and nails it between midwicket and mid-on. Right between the two fielders
punches it from the crease to mid-on
short of good length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches it crisply to the covers region
fullish ball on middle, stays in the crease and nudges it to midwicket
tucked away off the front foot to midwicket again
moves towards off stump early and laps this up fine, past the wicketkeeper's outstretched gloves and to the fine leg region. The ball is pulled back before the boundary

flighted and loopy, sliding in with the arm on middle and leg. Mendis tries to slog again but unlike the earlier shot, this time he does not have as much room. Lofts it well but only as far as the fielder guarding the square leg boundary as the ball goes straight down his throat
flatter trajectory, sliding in on middle and leg, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
short of a length, he has to back away and manufacture room as it does not spin much, punched to extra cover

short ball, does not get hold of the pull shot, that probably stopped on him a but and he gets beaten for pace. Fails to keep the pull shot along the ground but the ball drops short of the fielder running in from deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, slapped away off the backfoot to sweeper cover

short again, sitting up nicely and this time he finds the middle of the bat on the pull. Also places it well as he gets it well wide of the fielder at deep midwicket, to the right of him. Played between midwicket and mid-on
comes forward and pushes this fuller delivery and skews it off the outside edge to third man
good length ball, stays back and blocks into the off side, to the covers region
short of a length and angling in on Chandimal, who blocks it gently towards mid-on
fuller ball, comes forward and drills it off the front foot past the diving mid-on fielder

flat ball, slides in, but what a shot from Chandimal. Moves away and whips it off the pads away to deep midwicket. Kept a bit low but he clears the backfoot and uses a lot of bottom hand as well. Shot of the day so far, probably
defended back to the bowler
tucked through square on the leg side
flighted on the stumps, drilled down to long-on and they jog the single
good length ball, presses forward, drops it in front of covers and calls for a quick single
length ball, spinning in, tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side
pinches a single after pushing this between cover and point
full ball, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through flat and quick on leg stump, tucked away to square leg. Deep backward square leg charges in and fields it to deny the second run
backs away to cut but not enough room and he picks out point
fullish length ball, gets a good stride forward and blocks into the off side with bat close to pad
comes forward and pushes this fuller ball into the off side
nudged to the left of short leg, midwicket intercepts it
fuller on off, comes forward and drives close to the body to covers
flighted and sliding in on leg, driven to extra cover. Can't beat the fielder there
backs away to this length ball, keeping a bit low and he cannot pierce the covers region
Chandimal trying all he can to keep the score ticking but he cannot do a good job of it this over. Not picking the gaps. Plants the front foot forward and push-drives this one to mid-off
fuller and angling in on off, pushed off the front foot wide of covers
goes for a reverse sweep but cannot make contact as the ball is not full enough and he wears it on the body before the ball goes to the fine leg region
full outside off, sticks the bat out and pushes it through covers for a comfortable single
tucked off the pads to midwicket
full and flighted outside off, crunches a drive square of the wicket and sweeper cover runs across to pick it up

is that an edge? It was full and Tharanga was looking to crash it through the off side. Too full and he does not seem to have made contact as the ball hits the wicketkeeper's arm and goes away towards slip. Seems like he was beaten there
front foot drive, hit hard but cannot find the gap again, straight to cover
full and sliding in, driven just wide of mid-on
fuller ball, pushed off the inner part of the bat to the bowler
pushed off the middle of the bat this time and straight to the bowler again
tries to get the front foot out of the way and pull this away, loses balance as he does so and the ball goes to deep midwicket
fuller, flighted and on leg, pushed off the front foot, gets it off the inner part of the bat straight back to the bowler
short at off stump, backs away and slices it to backward point's left
full at off stump, driven to short cover
full at off stump, driven to cover
full at off stump, pushed to long-on

dropped. good length outside off, slides straight on and catches the outside edge as he plays inside the line. The edge goes low to first slip's left, and he's up too early. It hits his boot. That was Sarkar
short at off stump, chopped late past backward point again
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side with the turn
full at leg stump, pushed to silly mid-on
full and down the leg side, deflects off Liton's body and runs down, and he has to chase it himself
good length at middle stump, back foot defence
full outside off, drops it with soft hands through the short third man region, and Liton goes after it again
full at off stump, driven to cover
gets down to reverse sweep and the ball goes to deep midwicket. Taskin at deep square leg runs across and picks it up
drilled to midwicket
rapped on the pads and seems like it was quite high as it struck Chandimal on the back pad. Attempted reverse sweep again but the ball is a tad too short and he misses
worked to midwicket again
fuller ball, clipped away to midwicket
spinning in slightly from a length, punched past midwicket
gets down to sweep and the ball loops in on off, uses the angle to good effect to get it away behind square on the leg side
flighted up on off, driven off the front foot to long-off
pushed back to the bowler
length ball, tucked off the pads to midwicket
pitched up on off, pushed off the front foot to mid-off who is slightly deep
spinning away and Chandimal misses out on it. Sitting up nicely and he cuts it straight to extra cover
pitched up on off, defended back to the bowler off the front foot
loopy delivery, sliding in on off, defended off the front foot into the off side
pushed off the front foot to covers
good length and spinning away, waits for it to turn and blocks into the off side off the front foot
defended to the right of the bowler who runs across and picks it up
flighted outside off, pushes hard at it and the ball goes uppishly to the left of backward point
drilled off the pads through midwicket, pitched up ball, and raises his third Test century
spinning away outside off, punched off the backfoot to long-off
comes down the tack, gets on top of the pitch and launches this one over long-on. Goes clean and straight and bounces just in front of the advertisement hoarding
comes down the track and was looking to slog it big over the on side but Shakib drags the length back and the batsman makes no contact
short of good length, waits for it at the crease before pulling it to deep square leg
tossed up delivery, very wide, left alone outside off
tossed up outside off, lofts it through extra cover and the ball goes one-bounce over the boundary. That area is open and it is the offspinner bowling, he just chips it and does a nice job of it
reverse sweep. Now, they are having some fun. Goes through point as he gets in position early and times and places it to perfection
three fielders in the deep on the off side and he tries to go against the spin and slog it over leg, but misses

gone. Another big attempt at a slog sweep and loses his stumps as he makes no contact. Loopy delivery, sliding in on off and does not turn away as much as he would have liked. Just coming on with the arm and takes out off-stump
spinning away outside leg, takes some turn and the batsman lets it go

gets across a long way outside off and misses with the sweep as the bowler takes it down leg. Misses the sweep and the ball misses leg stump. But the keeper takes the bails off and he momentarily lost balance, so it remains to be seen if he has slid the bat back in. They refer the stumping and the batsman has just about managed to ground the bat and survives
width on offer outside off, opens the bat face and runs it towards third man

oh, gone. Nicely bowled. Gunaratne does not account for the turn. It's a length ball and he expects the ball to come on with the turn. Instead, it takes a little bit of turn and beats the outside edge of the bat to take out off stump
comes down the track and drills this to midwicket. No run there
gets down to sweep and the ball goes to short fine leg
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket. That's the 200 up for Sri Lanka
good length, sliding in with the arm on leg stump, comes forward and defends it back to the bowler
gets down to sweep, not full enough and the ball rises considerably after pitching to hit him flush on the throat. Yikes, that must have hurt
turn again. On a length and the batsman plays the angle but the ball turns outside the line and beats the outside edge
gets down to sweep and the ball goes to deep square leg
tucked behind square
comes down the track and clips this away to midwicket
tucked off the pads to square leg. The fielder sluggishly jogs behind it and they push him to come charging back for the second

appeal for lbw, turned down. Gets down to reverse sweep and misses. Gets struck on the pad. Mushfiqur has to run in from a long way to consult with the bowler and go for the review. It's a tossed up ball and sliding in. The drift takes the ball past the bottom of the bat as he is looking to reverse it but the question is wher ehas it struck him. No bat involved. The ball has spun some distance and there is also the drift to take into account. And it will only clip the stump, so on-field call remains
gets down to sweep again and gets an inside-edge to the pad
comes down the track and the bowler drags the length back, whips it away to midwicket
pushed off the front foot to extra cover
gets down to reverse sweep and is in no position to play that shot as the ball is around the outside off region. Can't make contact and the impact is outside off, so appeal turned down
comes down the track and works it away into the leg side
some room outside off and shorter in length, chops the cut
stays dangerously back to this fullish length ball, keeps a bit low but he manages to keep it out
full and pitched up, gets down to sweep and the ball is swept along to deep midwicket. It has carried all the way over the ropes
straightening and bouncing after pitching on middle and leg, nudged into the leg side
reverse sweep. In the air and shouts of catch it. One-bounce to the fielder at deep midwicket
very full ball, dug out back to the bowler
opens the bat face and plays this late to work this length ball away to third man region
comes down the track to meet the pitch of this before pushing it down to long-on
loopy delivery, angling in on leg, defended back to the bowler
not quite full enough but he picks the length early and sweeps it fine for a boundary. 400 lead up for Sri Lanka
defended off the inner part of the bat and the ball goes towards the non-striker
pitched up outside off, easy pickings as he reverse-sweeps it to the third man boundary. gets it wide of the slip fielder

oh, great catch. Tries the reverse sweep again and the wicketkeeper sticks the left glove out. He was not trying to hit it too hard, just tries to guide it through the third man region. The ball sticks on and he is quick to bring his hands together to make sure he holds on to it as he tumbles over to his left
good length at off stump, defended into the off side

dropped. Tossed up at middle stump, down the track, gets to the pitch and slogs this. Looks good at first, but it's got the toe of the bat on the inside half. Mahmudullah runs back and to his left, gets his hands up and tips it over the midwicket boundary as he falls down
good length outside off, he's playing for the turn, there isn't any. Beaten on the outside edge. Liton has appealed for stumping but third umpire replays show he was in
good length at middle stump, gets down the track again but he's too close to the ball. Jams it to deep square leg
short and wide, can't quite get behind this cut, pushes it to sweeper
good length at leg stump, stride forward and swept along the floor to long leg
good length at off stump, pushed to cover
good length outside off, steps out, not to the pitch, walks across and pushes it to midwicket
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, pushed to sweeper cover
yorker at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
short and wide, throws everything into this cut shot, top edge goes on the bounce to third man
full at off stump, pushed to sweeper cover who was caught flat-footed
short and wide, chopped to third man
short and wide, sits up, slapped well in front of sweeper cover
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
short and wide, hangs back and thumps it past extra cover. That was hit hard.
short and wide, dabbed to backward point
full at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at the pads, pushed to square leg off the back foot
full at off stump, pushed to cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to point off the front foot
good length, angling into the corridor, walks across and gets rapped on the pads as he tries to turn this into the leg side, inside edge too. Bowler is the only one appealing. Not ojut
good length at off stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, tucked to mid-on with the angle
good length outside off, puts a big stride forward and paddles it to long leg
good length at off stump, thick inside edge and it rolls into the leg side as he defends
full at off stump, pushed to cover
full at off stump, shuffles across and drags the sweep between long leg and deep square
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face last minute and executes a nice late cut, but third man is in there for a ramp and hence very fine
bouncer at middle stump, goes for the pull, misses and it flies over his shoulder and past the top edge
short at middle stump, backs away, clears the front leg and lifts the pull shot to the square leg boundary
short and wide, backs away again, but this time lifts it craftily over point
full at off stump, no feet, and it didn't look like he knew where the ball was either. Just hung the bat out, thick inside edge to fine leg
short at leg stump, pulled to fine leg
good length outside off, comes back in and he chops it into the ground, keeper takes it on the bounce
good length at middle stump, steps out and drops it into the leg side with soft hands, midwicket can't run in quickly enough from the boundary
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover's right
good length at middle stump, angles in and catches him on the pad as he tries to close the face, not out, says Erasmus
good length at middle stump, goes for the slog sweep, not to the pitch but he connects nicely on the up and gets it past deep midwicket who is running to his left
full at off stump, steps out and drives to cover
good length at off stump, tapped to gully
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
good length outside off, defended to gully
short outside off stump, hangs back and cuts to deep point to bring up his first fifty in eight innings
cutter, starts on a length at leg stump and fizzes cross, he pushes it to gully away from his body
cutter, short and wide outside off, goes for the cut and there's a tiny outside edge says Liton, and the umpire has heard it as well
good length, in the corridor, no movement, forward defence
back of a length outside off, pulls the bat inside the line and lets it go
good length outside off, angled across, left alone
good length outside off, angled away, left alone
good length outside off, finally loses his discipline and pokes at it, beaten on the outside  edge
good length at off stump, nips off the seam, lets it go
edged. Good length at off stump, straightens after pitching, pushes at it inside the line, thick edge past first slip
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, pushed to covers
full toss at middle stump, thumped past midwicket
full at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, flicked to square leg on the up
full, swings in slightly into the pads, gets a leading edge to mid-on as he tries to flick this
shot. Full outside off, leans into the cover drive and caresses it all along the floor past wide mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot, away from the body

falls short of third slip. Good length at off stump, angles in and straightens, along with some extra bounce. No feet from Tamim. He's squared up and gets an outside edge. Third slip dives one-handed to his left but it has landed short of him. Mendis with the effort
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, pushed to point
full at middle stump, swept to square leg, who puts in a dive to his left
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to cover
good length at off stump, defended into the off side on the up
full outside off, pushed to cover off the toe of the bat
good length outside off stump, defended into the off side
bouncer at middle stump, too short, ducks it
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes and defends into the off side
good length outside off, leaves it alone
full at off stump, gets to the pitch and crunches this past mid-off
back of a length at off stump, dabs it off the back foot into the covers
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full and drifted at leg stump, flicks it past short leg with soft hands
good length, outside off, opens the face to push it with the turn to backward point's right
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length in the corridor, mistimed back foot punch to wide mid-off
good length outside off, squeezed out to point with an open face
back of a length in the corridor, pushed on the up to point
good length outside off, pushes at it away from the body, on the up, and this one lands in front of Perera at gully
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
bouncer well outside off, tries to slam this out of the stadium, but it is rising and wide, he's nowhere near it
oooh. Turns back sharply from outside off, he wanted to cut this, but has to adjust and tap it into the floor with an angled bat
full outside off, waits for the turn, tickles it fine, makes sure the keeper doesn't have it and takes off
good length outside off, this goes straight through, keeps low and catches the outside edge low, rolls past slip
full at leg stump, gets to the pitch and punches it imperially past midwicket
full at middle stump, punches off the front foot again, but this time midwicket dives to his right and fields
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length, just outside off, covers the off stump and lets it go
back of a length in the corridor, nips back and hurries him as he tries to drop this into the off side off the back foot
good length at middle stump, pushes on the up to mid-on
good length outside off, nips away after pitching, off stump protected nicely again as he lets it go
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length outside off, defended into the off side

nearly gets him! Full at off stump, his eyes light up and he wants to thump this through the covers, but he doesn't want to get his feet close to the ball as he does so. Spins out of the rough, bat turns and it just evades short midwicket
good length at off, this time he gets to the pitch and plays with the turn to long-on
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off stump, hangs back and chops it past slip
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length outside off, forward defence
good length at off stump, defends back to the bowler off the back foot
bouncer at middle stump, gets himself in a tangle - half-crouching, head falling away, one leg in the air - and somehow manages to keep the hook shot on the floor, to fine leg
good length at middle stump, pushed wide of mid-on with soft hands
back of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
good length outside off, defended off the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, ducks it, but doesn't drop the bat
full outside off, forward defence
full at off stump, driven to long-on
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, a little too full for a sweep perhaps, but he's in that kind of mood. Gets fully low and swipes it through square leg

good length at off stump, fends at it and gets a thick inside edge that goes through the open short fine leg area. Sarkar wants to come back for a second - induces a wild throw, that eventually gives them the extra run at sweeper cover
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off
good length at middle stump,  defended to short leg off the back foot
short and wide, punched off the back foot through cover
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
short and wide, picks that spot through covers again with a back foot punch
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to point
good length at middle stump, defended to short leg
full at leg stump, pushed to deep square leg
full outside off stump, pushes at it, thick outside edge past slip
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full at leg stump, steps out, converts it into a full toss and gives this everything with the slog. There is a deep midwicket, but he didn't hesitate for a moment with this shot
back of a length at off stump, hangs back, pushes it through covers to bring up a superb counterattacking fifty
back of a length outside off, spins back in and cuts the room as he shapes to cut. Pushed feebly into the off side
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, gets the pad across, locks himself, but gets the bat in front in time to play the defence
good length at off stump, back foot defence
full at off stump, pushed to cover
good length at off stump, thick inside edge on the defence as this one comes back in with the arm

oh, nearly! good length, offspinner outside off from around the wicket, turns away slowly, he throws his hands at it and gets an inside edge that flies past the stumps...turns out it was a back-foot no ball.

oh! Has anyone warmed up properly? A flighted offspinner at off stump, good length, Sarkar is in two minds - wants to slash across, then checks his shot, bunts at it. Gets a leading edge that floats over short leg, who momentarily takes his eyes off the ball and can't catch it on his recovery as it balloons over him and comes down

got him! Gunaratne's awkward spinners from around the wicket have caused problems every ball he has bowled. It's floated in towards middle and off stump, pitches, spins away and clips the top of off stump. A perfect offspinner's ball. Sarkar thinks he's been given caught behind and wants to review it, no joy
back of a length at off stump, goes on the back foot and turns it to deep square leg
good length at off stump, forward defence
ohhhh this is teasing stuff. He's running in from 10 yards and flighting it. Outside off, good length, Tamim has to wait a long time to defend
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the back foot
full outside off stump, gets a short stride in and punches it past mid-of gloriously
good length and angled in at leg stump, gets the leg across and tickles it fine
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the up to wide mid-off
good length outside off, poked to backward point
good length, drifted in at off stump, gets his leg across and locks, inside half of the bat on the defence and it gets past short leg
full at off stump, forward defence
good length, wide outside off, mistimed drive on the up into the covers
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, back foot defence
overpitched on the pads, waits for it and flicks it past midwicket and gives long-on and deep square leg a long jog as they converge to cut it off
good length at off stump, goes back instinctively, hurries with a half stride and defends
good length at off stump, inside half on the defensive push
good length at off stump, thick outside edge as he pushes forward and defends

struck in front. He's been pulled forward against his instinct, gets one on the back of a length now and doesn't go back positively enough. Pitches on middle stump and straightens, traps him on middle stump and it's been given out. He has had a long discussion with Tamim, who tells him not to review it. He reviews it but walks away towards the pavilion. Didn't look he was convinced himself, but since he has made the signal, the review stands. There is no bat, confirms third umpire. It's pitching in line, hitting in line and clipping the top of middle stump.
good length at leg stump from around the wicket, goes on the back foot and tucks it past short leg
good length at middle stump, watched closely and defended to short leg
back of a length at off stump, stays in his crease, waits for the turn and defends it under his eye
good length outside off, forward defence back to the bowler
wide of the crease, back of a length and turning in at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence to the bowler
good length at middle stump, defended with the turn to short leg
back of a length at leg stump, hurries him and gets a thick inside edge that trickles fine
good length at off stump, pushed to cover
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, forward defence

good ball. Drifted in at off stump at a good length, pitches and turns away sharply, along with bounce. Tamim has been coming across with the pad all along. Once more it shortens his reach. He's defending well in front of his body and it catches the shoulder of the bat and bobbles up easily for first slip
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, forward defence, inside half of the bat
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
back of a length at middle stump, back foot defence

good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
short and turning in at off stump, gets behind it and whips it classily to deep midwicket

back of a length and angled across, goes on the back foot and pushes it to deep point
full at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length outside off, beaten in flight but pushes this through covers on the up
full at leg stump, driven to mid-on with soft hands

good length outside off, pushed into the off side
good length, angled in at off stump, watches closely defends it off the back foot
full at off stump, pushes it back to the bowler

another arm ball, good length, goes back again and gets an inside edge that sneaks between his legs and goes wide of the stumps
tosses it up outside off, good length, lets it go
short and wide, connects on the cut, and Sandakan misfields at point to give away a run
good length at middle stump, shimmies down and pushes it to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, goes back and opens the face to chop it past first slip as it spins back in
good length at off stump, drifts and turns, Shakib follows with his hands and gets an outside edge the sneaks past low to a diving first slip's left
full at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, controlled pull shot to long leg
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
full at off stump, lulls him into the drive on the up, straight to mid-off
wide of the crease, arm ball at middle stump off a good length, goes back, inside half onto front foot, onto back pad
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, waits for this and executes a balanced cover drive past short extra
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the front foot
full at off stump, tries to whip acorss the line, inside edge onto pad
short and at off stump, cuts straight to backward point
short and wide, cut past cover-point to find the sweeper
good length at off stump, steps out and flicks it short midwicket
full at off stump, driven into the open cover region, wins that psychological battle - for now - and picks up three
full at off stump, inside half on the forward defence
drifted in full at leg stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover-point off the back foot
full at middle stump, squeezed out with the turn to sweeper cover

leg slip dives forward to dismiss Shakib. This is looped at off stump, draws him forward and he's not to the pitch. Fends at it off the front foot, but it turns, catches his glove and balloons in front of Karunaratne who lunges forward to take it
full at off stump, pushed to cover

and another! Trapped in front by the arm ball. Goes slightly wide of the crease, pitches at middle stump, goes on with the angle. Mahmudullah has plonked his leg across, goes for the forward defence and bat hits his front foot as the ball sneaks by and hits him on the back leg in front of leg stump
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
short and wide, rocks back and hits the cut uppishly to deep point
full outside off, tries to drive into the off side, gets an inside edge into the leg side
short and wide, this goes straight through, cut to deep point
back of a length at middle stump, goes deep in the crease and pulls it out to deep midwicket
arm ball at middle stump, good length, inside half of the bat on the forward defence
good length at middle stump, defended into the off side
full toss outside off, his only intention was to find the boundary, and he does with a drive through extra cover
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler

arm ball, pitches at middle stump, traps him on the angle. There was bat on it for sure, but we'll have to see if it was pad first. Looks like it might have been sliding down - Erasmus gives it not out. They review it...and there is an inside edge before it hits pad. The decision stands.
good length at off stump, defended to silly point
full outside off, flicked behind square on the leg side with the turn
wrong'un, full at middle stump, goes low and sweeps it off his toes to long leg
back of a length outside off, waits for the turn and pushes it into the off side off the back foot

good length at off stump, pushed into the leg side
wrong'un, short and wide, he makes room for the cut but is too far away because of the turn. Past the outside edge

good length at middle stump, steps out, makes room and middles the drive to mid-off's left....he ambles across and puts in the dive after it goes past him
good length, arm ball outside off, left alone. clips the top of the pad as it goes by and there's a loud appeal from everyone but the bowler
good length, down the leg side, misses out on the sweep
good length at leg stump, misses out on the sweep again and gets it on the pads
full at off stump, pushed into the off side

133 kph, bouncer climbs sharply at middle stump, fended square into the leg side with soft hands

full outside off, stretches his arms, and rives on the up through extra cover. Lakmal runs a long way from deep point and keeps it in with a dive...subject to third umpire replay, he's fine

good length, tossed up at good length, strikes him on the pad, but outside leg stump
good length at off stump, driven to mid-off to bring up the fifty partnership
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the back foot
his first seam up ball of the match, full at leg stump, flicked wide of long leg, where Kumara tumbles low to his left
back to offpsin. Good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at middle stump, defended to short leg
back of a length outside off, spins away sharply and past the outside edge as he pokes at it
full outside off, pushed into the covers

wide of the crease, arm ball, good length outside off, defended into the off side
full at off stump, driven to mid-off

tucked into the leg side for a single

oh, my goodness! What a way to get out. This one is pitched on leg stump and spins away further down leg. Mushfiqur is trying to tuck it into the leg side, fine, but gets an edge to the wicketkeeper. Nirshan Dickwella continues to effect dismissals down the leg side. That's bad, bad way to get out. Bangladesh in serious trouble now
fuller ball, pushed towards mid-on
stays in the crease and tucks this length ball on the bounce to short leg
pitched up ball, angled across and drifting away, the batsman comes forward to defend and the drift means the ball goes off the outer part of the bat to the fielder at silly point
tucked off the pads fine on the leg side and they come charging back for the second run. Manages to beat the throw from the fielder but only just. Pretty tight single
length ball, defended from the crease
punched into the off side. No run there
flighted on middle and off and spinning away, comes forward and blocks to the covers region
hangs back to this length ball and blocks with a straight bat
short of a length, uses the depth of the crease before tucking it off the pads through the midwicket region
flighted and straightening from the fourth-stump channel, left alone by the batsman
pushed across the right-hander outside off, tries to cut but the ball is not short enough and he gets it to point
pitched up ball, pushed uppishly past the right of the bowler to wide mid-on
width offered up outside off again and it is cut off the backfoot through backward point
stays back to this length ball that spins in to him from middle and off and blocks it to short leg
gets down to sweep and gets it fine, deep backward square leg has to run across and collect it and that gives them enough time to come back for the second

wrong'un from Sandakan and drift away outside off. The batsman chases it and does not pick it at all. The ball goes further away from him as it turns the other way and he is forced to leave it in the end
flighted outside off, comes forward and blocks off the outer part of the bat into the off side

and another soft dismissal. And there is the record. Rangana Herath has surpassed Daniel Vettori to become the most successful left-arm spinner in Test cricket. He is mobbed but his team-mates and what a moment for Sri Lanka cricket. Coming to the delivery, it was nicely flighted by Herath and Das looks to slog it big over the leg side. Gets a leading edge for his troubles - went too hard at it - and the ball is held by the cover fielder who runs back a couple of steps to complete a fairly straightforward catch

pitched up outside off, pushed off the front foot towards mid-off and they take off for an ill-advised single. Lakmal is slightly slow in getting off the blocks. Nonetheless, he manages to fire a direct hit at the non-striker's end but the batsman has made his ground. The feet are in the air but the bat is firmly planted into the ground. He bends forward and drags it over the crease
left alone in the channel outside off as it straightens from the fourth-stump channel
pushed off the front foot to mid-off
pitched up outside off, Mehedi comes forward and crunches a cover drive but cannot beat the fielder positioned there
offers his pad to this fullish length ball. It spins back in, is the wrong'un and not picked up by Taskin. But the front foot was way outside and the impact was outside off
shuffles across to this wide delivery outside off and lets it go

moves across to this length ball outside off before tucking it fine. He inside-edges it to the pads and the ball goes fine. They come back for the second and seems like there could be trouble at the striker's end. But the batsman has ground his bat and has made it back safely
shuffles back and taps this ball to short leg

pitched on leg and spinning further down, the batsman cannot put bat to ball as he tries to work it away and the ball evades Dickwella as well and goes to the fine leg region. One run short as the batsman does not put bat over the crease
drifting away on a length, defended off the front foot into the off side
pitched up on the pads, clipped off them to deep backward square leg
defended back to the bowler
tossed up on off and middle, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
offers up some width outside off, not as loopy this time around and lands on a fullish length, driven square of the wicket and splits point and cover
tucked off the pads and forward short leg dives to his right to stop it clean
shuffles across outside off and lets it go
defended back to the bowler
gets in position to tuck it away as he gets across but the ball spins the other way and sharply and he lets it go late. Taskin has no clue about that and he indicates as much with a wry smile
goes after a wide delivery and tries to force it through the off side. No where near the pitch of it and gets beaten

signalled byes. Seemed like an inside edge for a moment. Taskin was looking to force it through the off side and the ball dips and keeps a bit low. It's the wrong'un and the ball misses the bat and goes to the fine leg region after missing the keeper as well
moves across again and this one spins a mile into him the other way and the ball misses leg stump. Again, no clue how that one turns
defended off the front foot and the outside part of the bat to the off side
and this time the front foot defence goes off the inside part of the bat and into the leg side
now a defence off the middle of the blade, blocked to covers off the front foot
tossed up and fuller in length as well, driven off the front foot to sweeper cover

gone. Comes forward to defend, probably expecting the ball to come on with the arm. But it takes some turn and goes off the inside edge to the pad and lobs straight into the hands of Kusal Mendis at short leg
defended off the front foot back to the bowler
slider, drifting away outside off and goes past the outside edge of Mehedi who tries to defend
sprayed down the leg side. Halfway down the pitch. Gets down on one knee and pulls this away to deep fine leg
comes forward to this fuller ball outside off and blocks it into covers
length ball, spinning in from middle and off, defended to short leg
slog sweep and gone all the way for six. Pitched up and right in the slot for Mehedi, who hits it with the breeze and dispatches it over deep square leg
paddle sweep for four this time. Gets down low and early and takes it on the full before just guiding it to the fine leg boundary
defended off the front foot, off the outer part of the bat to covers
comes forward and blocks it towards mid-off
pitched up on off, clipped away to midwicket

five-wicket haul for Herath. For the 23rd time in Sri Lanka. Mustafizur expects this one to spin in a lot more and is playing for the turn. But the ball drifts in from outside off and goes on to beat the outside edge and uproot off-stump
pitched up on off, defended off the front foot to the off side
backs away and leaves a wide gap between bat and pad as he defends this one back to the bowler
stays back to this length ball and defends it down the pitch
comes on to the front foot and defends to mid-off
plats the front foot right across and defends
whipped away off the backfoot to mid-on who is slightly deep
defended from the crease into the off side

was that a drop? Did it carry? Very, very tough chance, though. Subashis was forward defending and gets a thick inside edge that flies to the left of short leg who gets down but the ball is coming to him real quick and he cannot hold on to it. Great effort
driven out to sweeper cover
shuffles across and defends down the pitch off the backfoot
pitched up wider outside off and it is crunched out to sweeper cover. Does not take the single again
defended off the inside part of the blade to short leg
defends it off the front foot and the ball takes late turn to go off the outside edge towards the cordon
tucked off the pads to the left of square leg, gets it between him and the midwicket fielder for a good single. Will keep the strike.
stays in the crease and defends down the pitch
defended to the left of the bowler from the crease
drifting away outside off and he looks for an almighty drive but the ball spins in to beat the bat and that's a good stop from the keeper
keeps it out into the off side from the crease
tucked off the pads between midwicket and square leg and just one ball for the tailender to survive
and he survives the one ball. Pushed to silly point from the crease who collects it and throws it back to the keeper
comes forward and defends to covers

chips it to mid-off and that's the end of it. Six for Herath and Sri Lanka take a 1-0 lead in the series. Flighted and drifting in from outside off. Given the drift, he cannot make good connection and he was also not to the pitch of the ball. Harmlessly sends it into the hands of mid-off and that will be it
